properties.areaDesc: Haakon; Butte; Wyoming Black Hills; Ziebach; Perkins; Northern Meade Co Plains; Northeastern Crook; Harding; Western Crook
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 8 at 12:42PM MST until February 9 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
...SNOW LATE TODAY INTO TOMORROW...

.The next storm system will impact the area beginning this
afternoon. Heavy upslope snow is expected over the northern Black
Hills and adjacent foothills late tonight through tomorrow
morning, bringing several inches of new snow. Additionally, a band
of heavy snow will move across northwestern South Dakota this
afternoon and evening. High snowfall rates within this band could
lead to rapid onset of hazardous travel conditions. Snow showers
are expected elsewhere across northeastern Wyoming and western
South Dakota through tonight before tapering off early tomorrow.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches
with locally higher amounts possible over northwestern South
Dakota.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast and the Black Hills of Wyoming
and northwestern and southwestern South Dakota.

* WHEN...Until 9 AM MST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow in the advisory area is
expected to fall in a narrow band across northwestern South
Dakota. Snowfall rates around an inch per hour in this band
could lead to rapid deterioration of road conditions this
afternoon and evening.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the
5 1 1 app for your state.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST SUNDAY
